intro: Dactylostemon klotzschii var. spathulatus, commonly known as the broad-leafed dactylostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically orange or yellow in color. The plant has smooth, often succulent stems and broad, ovate leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and the plant is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
